page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT
page.content: { All figures relate to 220 households {surveyed The average number of people working in each family is 1.5. About 50% of the population is employed. More people work in the public rather than the private sector. Those employed in the private sector tend to work in industry. The majority of those employed have skilled jobs. Few people have to travel widely for their job, and few work shifts. Working abroad is uncommon. Of those employed, about 50% need to use computer technology as part of their jobs. 80% of working people belong to Trades Unions. Employment in families is centred on the man, with few married women in employment.80% of families have at least one member receiving unemployment benefit. The prime industry is manufacturing.
